questions.question: What does CFG stand for in the context of formal languages?
Which of the following is NOT a valid component of a production rule in a context-free grammar?
What is the primary purpose of converting a Context-Free Grammar (CFG) to Chomsky Normal Form (CNF)?

answers.d: To add more complexity to the grammar

questions.question: Which of the following statements about context-free grammars is TRUE?

answers.a: Every CFG can generate a regular language
answers.b: Every CFG can be represented by a pushdown automaton
answers.c: CFGs cannot have recursive production rules
answers.d: Every CFG can be converted to an equivalent regular grammar
